description: From French mordant, from Latin morde≈ç. Doublet of mordent.

adjectives.description: mordant (comparative more mordant, superlative most mordant)

entries.meaning: Having or showing a sharp or critical quality
examples: Synonyms: biting, caustic, sarcastic, keen, severe

entries.meaning: Serving to fix a dye to a fibre.
Any substance used to facilitate the fixing of a dye to a fibre; usually a metallic compound which reacts with the dye using chelation.
Any corrosive substance used in etching.
A glutinous size used as a ground for gilding, to make the gold leaf adhere.

verbs.description: mordant (third-person singular simple present mordants, present participle mordanting, simple past and past participle mordanted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To subject to the action of, or imbue with, a mordant.
